name: Avoid using process.exit()
description: The process.exit() method in Node.js is used to immediately stop the Node.js process and exit. This is a dangerous operation because it can occur in any method at any point in time, potentially stopping a Node.js application completely when an error occurs. This rule is compliant with CISQ OMG ASCSM-CWE-396, ASCSM-CWE-397, ASCRM-RLB-01 recommendations.
output:
Line and column for each violation 
Associated value => number of violations found
rationale: Ensure that some critical method are properly implemented. The misuse of system methods could lead to production issues and will have a huge impact on the application reliability.
remediation: Check that process.exit() is not used

technicalCriteria.name: Programming Practices - Error and Exception Handling

qualityStandards.name: Empty exception block
qualityStandards.description: Remove instances where an exception handling block (such as catch and finally blocks) of a function, method, procedure, stored procedure, sub-routine, etc. does not contain any instruction

qualityStandards.name: Catch of overly broad exception types
qualityStandards.description: Remove instances where the function, method, procedure, stored procedure, sub-routine, etc. contains a catch which declares to catch an exception whose type is part of a list of overly broad exception types

qualityStandards.name: Throw of overly broad exception types
qualityStandards.description: Remove instances where the function, method, procedure, stored procedure, sub-routine, etc. throws an exception whose type is part of a list of overly broad exception types

qualityStandards.name: Injection
qualityStandards.description: Injection flaws, such as SQL, OS, and LDAP injection occur when untrusted data is sent to an interpreter as part of a command or query. The attackers' hostile data can trick the interpreter into executing unintended commands or accessing data without proper authorization.
